articles.description:
We are excited to announce the availability of first public preview of the SharePoint Framework (SPFx) 1.16 – with updates for Viva Connections, Microsoft Teams and SharePoint Online experiences. This is baseline release for the upcoming 1.16 and you can expect much more new features within upcoming preview releases before version is officially ready for production use.
The post Public preview of SharePoint Framework 1.16 – First release of upcoming features appeared first on Microsoft 365 Developer Blog.
articles.title: Public preview of SharePoint Framework 1.16 – First release of upcoming features

articles.author: Bob German
articles.description:
Learn how to build applications for Microsoft Teams, and how to sell them in the Microsoft Teams App Store in the Microsoft Teams App Camp, which launches today at https://aka.ms/app-camp!
The post Introducing Microsoft Teams App Camp appeared first on Microsoft 365 Developer Blog.
articles.title: Introducing Microsoft Teams App Camp

articles.author: Ben Summers
articles.description:
Today we’re announcing several new ways for Cloud Storage Partners to integrate their services with Office and Teams.  
The post How Cloud Storage Partners integrate their services with Microsoft Teams and Office appeared first on Microsoft 365 Developer Blog.
articles.title: How Cloud Storage Partners integrate their services with Microsoft Teams and Office

articles.author: Ayca Bas
articles.description:
Follow this tutorial to build your first Teams tab with ASP.NET Core and Teams Toolkit for Visual Studio to boost productivity.nerally available! Learn how to build your first Teams tab with ASP.NET Core, using Teams Toolkit, to boost productivity.
The post Build a productivity dashboard with Microsoft Teams Toolkit for Visual Studio appeared first on Microsoft 365 Developer Blog.
articles.title: Build a productivity dashboard with Microsoft Teams Toolkit for Visual Studio

articles.author: Microsoft Graph team
articles.description:
Learn about the new features in To Do tasks API and the retirement of the Tasks (Beta) API in Microsoft Graph.
The post New features in Microsoft Graph To Do APIs and retirement of the Tasks (Beta) API appeared first on Microsoft 365 Developer Blog.
articles.title: New features in Microsoft Graph To Do APIs and retirement of the Tasks (Beta) API

articles.author: SharePoint team
articles.description:
In February of 2021 we announced a new permission to grant Microsoft Graph applications access to specific site collections. Using Sites.Selected along with the Sites permissions endpoint in Microsoft Graph allows you to set the specific site collections and access level you want to grant to individual applications.
The post Updates on controlling app specific access on specific SharePoint sites (Sites.Selected) appeared first on Microsoft 365 Developer Blog.
articles.title: Updates on controlling app specific access on specific SharePoint sites (Sites.Selected)

articles.author: Microsoft Graph team
articles.description:
Changes are coming in August 2022 to how Microsoft handles the Microsoft Teams call data that we expose via Microsoft Graph's callRecords APIs (beta and v1.0).
The post Upcoming changes to data visibility for Microsoft Graph callRecords APIs appeared first on Microsoft 365 Developer Blog.
articles.title: Upcoming changes to data visibility for Microsoft Graph callRecords APIs

articles.author: John Miller
articles.description:
Building and extending Microsoft Teams with apps can feel overwhelming. Or maybe you’re just learning that it’s possible to extend Teams with embedded UI content, custom search, and more.  There’s a lot to absorb around what Teams has to offer, and there are so many tools and technologies to help you build the right app.
The post Post notifications to Microsoft Teams with .NET using Teams Toolkit for Visual Studio appeared first on Microsoft 365 Developer Blog.
articles.title: Post notifications to Microsoft Teams with .NET using Teams Toolkit for Visual Studio

articles.author: Microsoft 365 Platform team
articles.description:
We are pleased to announce a new public version of the SharePoint Framework, v1.15.2, with new features, capabilities and fixes for Microsoft Viva, Microsoft Teams and SharePoint.
The post Announcing SharePoint Framework 1.15.2 with updates for Viva Connections, Microsoft Teams and SharePoint appeared first on Microsoft 365 Developer Blog.
articles.title: Announcing SharePoint Framework 1.15.2 with updates for Viva Connections, Microsoft Teams and SharePoint

articles.author: Mathangi Chakrapani
articles.description:
Today, we’re announcing the general availability of Azure Fluid Relay and Fluid Framework azure-client v1.0 library for all web developers. Fluid Framework and Azure Fluid Relay service are now ready to power production-quality solutions.
The post Announcing general availability of Azure Fluid Relay service appeared first on Microsoft 365 Developer Blog.
articles.title: Announcing general availability of Azure Fluid Relay service

articles.author: Chris Dietsch
articles.description:
Office is shipping a new feature that enables PDFs created from Office using Export to PDF or Save As PDF to retain the source document’s labels or encryption into the output PDF. Office also enables Office Add-in developers to hook into and reuse some or all of Office’s PDF creation code.
The post Changes in Export to PDF with sensitivity labeling and encryption in Office Add-ins appeared first on Microsoft 365 Developer Blog.
articles.title: Changes in Export to PDF with sensitivity labeling and encryption in Office Add-ins

articles.author: Microsoft Graph team
articles.description:
We are excited to announce the general availability of the Microsoft Graph APIs for Microsoft Purview eDiscovery (Premium) to help you automate common eDiscovery workflows and integrate third party applications into eDiscovery (Premium). 
The post eDiscovery API for Microsoft Graph is now generally available appeared first on Microsoft 365 Developer Blog.
articles.title: eDiscovery API for Microsoft Graph is now generally available

articles.author: Microsoft Graph team
articles.description:
We are delighted to announce that application permissions for Bookings APIs in Microsoft Graph are now available on the v1 endpoint. 
The post Application permissions for Bookings APIs in Microsoft Graph now available on v1 appeared first on Microsoft 365 Developer Blog.
articles.title: Application permissions for Bookings APIs in Microsoft Graph now available on v1

articles.author: Tricia Van Hollebeke
articles.description:
Adaptive Card-based Loop components bring business content to the apps where your customers already collaborate and enable them to complete common tasks in the flow of their work. Today, we are happy to share the developer private preview is now available. 
The post Announcing Microsoft Loop component developer private preview now available appeared first on Microsoft 365 Developer Blog.
articles.title: Announcing Microsoft Loop component developer private preview now available

articles.author: Microsoft Teams team
articles.description:
Microsoft will start restricting access via EWS to Microsoft Teams message data starting on September 30th, 2022.  Fully supported access to Teams message data is available through the Microsoft Graph Teams Export API.
The post Restricted access to Microsoft Teams data via EWS starts September 30, 2022  appeared first on Microsoft 365 Developer Blog.
articles.title: Restricted access to Microsoft Teams data via EWS starts September 30, 2022

articles.author: Isaac Vargas Chacon
articles.description:
We are pleased to announce that PHP developers can now integrate their applications with Microsoft Graph. And, using the new Microsoft Graph PHP SDK, developers can also now access Microsoft services data from both beta and v1 endpoints with enhanced programmability experience.
The post Microsoft Graph PHP SDK 2.0.0-RC5 is now available appeared first on Microsoft 365 Developer Blog.
articles.title: Microsoft Graph PHP SDK 2.0.0-RC5 is now available

articles.author: Microsoft Graph team
articles.description:
Starting July 25, 2022, we’re introducing some parameter changes to Microsoft 365 Apps usage reports HTTP requests. This will affect APIs in the Microsoft Graph beta endpoint.
The post Changes to Microsoft 365 Apps usage reports API in Microsoft Graph appeared first on Microsoft 365 Developer Blog.
articles.title: Changes to Microsoft 365 Apps usage reports API in Microsoft Graph

articles.author: Kartik Datwani
articles.description:
Today, we are happy to announce the developer preview for unified meetings apps in Microsoft Teams Voice over IP (VoIP), including both one-on-one and group calls.
The post Introducing apps in Microsoft Teams Voice over IP (VoIP) calls appeared first on Microsoft 365 Developer Blog.
articles.title: Introducing apps in Microsoft Teams Voice over IP (VoIP) calls

articles.author: Microsoft 365 Platform team
articles.description:
Giving people quick access to what they need is key to providing a great user experience in any application. Today, we’re excited to announce the general release of OneDrive File Picker v8, which enables you to directly integrate Microsoft 365 services into your own web applications.
The post OneDrive File Picker v8 now Generally Available! appeared first on Microsoft 365 Developer Blog.
articles.title: OneDrive File Picker v8 now Generally Available!

articles.author: Microsoft 365 Platform team
articles.description:
We are excited to announce General Availability (GA) of the SharePoint Framework (SPFx) 1.15 with new features and capabilities for Microsoft Viva, Microsoft Teams and SharePoint – not forgetting technical updates across the platform.
The post Announcing SharePoint Framework 1.15 – with updates for Viva Connections, Microsoft Teams and SharePoint appeared first on Microsoft 365 Developer Blog.
articles.title: Announcing SharePoint Framework 1.15 – with updates for Viva Connections, Microsoft Teams and SharePoint
